title.narrative: KI Enhancing National Food Security in the context of CC

description.narrative: This is the PPG Phase of Kiribati Food Security Project which is being designed to build the adaptive capacity of vulnerable Kiribati communities to ensure food security under conditions of climate change.

title.narrative: Outer Island Water and Food Project

description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Number of additional males benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Number of additional females benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Total number of additional people benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Total number of people above 15 years of age who acquired new jobs through a UNDP-supported project on NRM, ecosystems services, chemicals and waste

This is the PPG Phase of Kiribati Food Security Project which is being designed to build the adaptive capacity of vulnerable Kiribati communities to ensure food security under conditions of climate change.

Energy - policy, planning and administration
This project will help with capacity building for mainstreaming Multilateral Environmental Agreements (MEA) objectives into inter-ministerial structures and mechanisms

title.narrative: Integrating global environmental priorities into national policies and programmes

description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Number of additional males benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Number of additional females benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Total number of additional people benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Total number of people above 15 years of age who acquired new jobs through a UNDP-supported project on NRM, ecosystems services, chemicals and waste
The project's objective is to improve information management and compliance monitoring in order to achieve global environmental benefits.
capital of a political entity
Energy - policy, planning and administration

For ATLAS Output 1: 1.1: An environmental data repository architecture in place. 1.2: Information technologies in place to store the data repository. 1.3: Agreements for data sharing in place. 1.4: Use of this environmental information in decision-making and policy-making. 1.5: Environmental information is shared regionally and internationally. 1.6: Quality, quantity and timeliness of reports submitted to conventions. 1.7: Public states higher awareness of environmental information products.
For ATLAS Output 2: 2.1: Adequate environmental indicators monitored. 2.2: Adequate national standards, norms, procedures for monitoring these environmental indicators are officially in place. 2.3: An in-service training programme for public servants include course(s) covering environmental information management and monitoring system. 2.4: Number of public servants trained by taking the course(s) on EMIS and CMS.

comment.narrative: 1.1: Review of ECD's information system as preliminary work towards the review of existing databases and management information. 1.2: Recommended list of software and hardware, along with cost estimations, for improving ECD's information system.

1.1: A list of identified environmental data, reporting obligations, and information needs of key stakeholders. 1.2: A list of hardware, communication and networking equipment required to collect and store environmental data are procured. 1.3: Reviewed protocols for environmental data-sharing, draft official standards, norms and procedures for review by the relevant organizations.
2.1: A list of environmental indicators are integrated in the respective M&E procedures of relevant key agencies and organizations. 2.2: Draft protocols, standards, norms and procedures in line with internationally recognized environmental monitoring guidelines. 2.3: A training programme on environmental monitoring is developed and partly implemented.

1.4: Equipment installed, staff are trained and the EMIS is operational. 1.5: EMIS is used for regional and international reporting.
2.4: An in-service training programme is established.
